titles.title: Medical License Verification Act
Medical License Verification Act

A bill to amend title XI of the Social Security Act to require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to verify whether a health care provider is licensed in good standing before issuing the provider a unique health identifier, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary:
Medical License Verification Act
This bill requires the Department of Health and Human Services to implement an automated system to verify whether an applicant for a unique health identifier has a valid state license to practice in a health care profession before providing the applicant with such an identifier.
